Title: Punjab govt cell to help youths get jobs abroad
Content:
This story is from January 20, 2020

CHANDIGARH: Dumping its own plan to hire a private firm to help unemployed youths find jobs in foreign countries, the Punjab government has decided to directly play the role of facilitator by setting up its own placement cell.

The government dropped the plan fearing that a private firm might misuse the authority. The move has further delayed implementation of the plan the government was planning to roll out by mid-2019 to save youths from unscrupulous travel agents.

The firm was to assist 5,000 youths to move overseas annually. Now, the government will set up its own ‘foreign placement and study cell’ for which it has given itself a deadline of two months. Department of employment generation and training secretary Rahul Tewari said 10 experts would be deputed in the cell.

Title: UP cops 'take away' blankets, water bottles from protesters
Content:
This story is from January 20, 2020

A policeman carries blankets, allegedly of anti-CAA protesters to thwart their demonstration, in Lucknow on Sa... Read More

LUCKNOW: A group of women continued their protest against the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) at the Ghantaghar Park here on Sunday with some of them alleging that policemen took away their blankets, a charge dismissed by the police.

On the lines of Delhi's Shaheen Bagh, the women along with children have been squatting near the Clock Tower in Lucknow's old quarters protesting the CAA and National Register of Citizens.

The women protesters alleged that blankets provided to them by some organisations were taken away by police.

Rejecting the claims made by the women protesters, the Lucknow Police in a tweet said, "During the illegal protest going on at Lucknow's Ghantaghar Park (Clock Tower), some people tried to make a 'gheraa' (cordon) using ropes and sticks, and also tried to put sheets. They were not allowed to do so. Some organisations were distributing blankets in park premises. As a result of which, people living in the vicinity, who are not part of the protests, were coming to take the blankets."

"Police removed those persons and organisations distributing blankets there, and action is being initiated against them," the Lucknow Police said, and urged people not to spread rumours.

Lucknow's Police Commissioner Sujeet Pandey also dismissed the allegations levelled by the protesters.

A 27-second video clip emerged on social media which purportedly shows a policeman carrying blankets and sheets in a plastic bag. A woman could be seen in the video shouting at him and calling him "thief", but police personnel did not respond to it. The protest at Lucknow's Ghantaghar started Friday night.

The BJP said the protest by the women was "sponsored by the Congress and the Samajwadi Party".

UP BJP spokesperson Chandramohan in a statement said, "The protest by the women is sponsored by the Congress and the Samajwadi Party. During the anti-CAA protests in December, unruly elements indulged in violence under the patronage of SP and Congress. The UP government acted tough on these unruly elements, and seized their property after identifying them. This action made the SP and the Congress agitated." Chandramohan also said that the people have understood the activities of both these parties, and this is the reason that despite efforts of these parties, "only a handful of Muslim women are staging protest." pti

Title: West Bengal: 50-70 lakh infiltrators will be identified, sent back, says Dilip Ghosh
Content:
This story is from January 20, 2020

West Bengal BJP president Dilip Ghosh

KOLKATA: Bengal BJP president Dilip Ghosh said on Sunday 50-70 lakh “infiltrators” would be identified, their names struck off the voters’ list and sent back. He added the government was committed to implementing NRC nationwide and would send back Bangladeshi Muslims living here illegally.

Trinamool secretary general Partha Chatterjee said: “They (BJP leaders) are in a fight among themselves to outdo each other. The more they speak, it is better for us, people will get to know them better. They are teaching us Hinduism as if we need to learn from them. CM Mamata Banerjee has always stood up for people’s rights. In doing so, she has never for once thought about their religion, caste and creed. It is for people’s right she is fighting again. They may try to do politics with religion, but they will never succeed in Bengal. Their fight is about exclusivity, ours is about inclusivity.”

Ghosh’s comments came on a day his party MP Saumitra Khan termed intellectuals who oppose CAA as Baner-jee’s “dogs”, drawing fire from TMC leaders, who said “BJP leaders are trying to outpace each other in mouthing profanities”.

Subodh Sarkar, a recipient of Sahitya Akademi Award, said: “This is the actual language of BJP. Now, it is up to the people to decide.”

Ghosh continued his tirade against eminent personalities opposing CAA and NRC, saying their “hearts bleed for infiltrators”. “What about Hindu refugees? They don’t have any answers. This is double standards,” he said.

Title: Horoscope Today, January 20, 2020: Check astrological prediction for Leo, Virgo, Libra, Scorpio and other signs
Content:
This story is from January 20, 2020

What will this day bring you? Here is what the stars foretell on what lies ahead today...

Aries

Today, your moon is not in a good position, you may feel dull and you may have health issues. You may face losses in this period. It is advised not to invest into risky assets. Your gains may likely to convert into losses. You should stop to invest in worthless objects. You should avoid to be involved in controversies, otherwise it may pull you down negatively and make you upset on small things.

Taurus

Today you are blessed by moon. Love would be in the air in terms of personal life. Singles may find suitable match. You may do better in terms of professional life. Your friends and subordinate staff may likely to support you.

Gemini

Today you may have confidence which may reflect in to your way of working. You are in the winning position in terms of opponents and enemies. You may have a good focus towards your goals. Health issues may be good. In domestic life try to avoid unnecessary arguments, it may affect your domestic harmony.

Cancer

You may be happy due to blessing from auspicious planetary combination. You may have some sort of positive energy which may create your prestige among people around you. You may spend your time to study intellectual stuff. You will also plan for higher studies.

Leo

Today you may feel negative vibrations around you, which may make you unhappy; you are advised to avoid making investments on worthless assets. You may also notice that friends and people around you may not be supportive today. You are advised to not to expect anything from anyone in terms of help, otherwise it may make you nervous. It is advised to take independent decisions today.

Virgo

Today you may not able to present yourself logically. You may have a dull feeling, which may give you lack of confidence. You need to follow your intuition while taking decisions in terms of investment. People around you may not be cooperative in terms of routine work. You are advised to be careful in eating unhealthy food to avoid stomach issues.

Libra

Today, you are likely to be more excited due to cooperation of your family and friends. You may plan to renovate your house or may bring some souvenir stuff to maintain your standard, which may increase your social status. You may expect increase of your fixed assets.

Scorpio

Today is a good day in terms of gains. You may get result with less effort. Your losses may convert into profits with the help of your wisdom. You may plan to upgrade yourself by doing academics course. You may donate some amount to religious place or charity. You may also help needy persons. Some investment into intellectual asset may be possible. Students may do better.

Sagittarius

Today you may feel dull, you may have some health related issues. Chronic diseases may reappear. You are advised to avoid rush driving and hurry. You are advised to avoid conflicts with the business partner, so avoid to take important decisions in terms of business. Investments in business or work is advised to be postponed. With the blessings from elders, by the late evening, things may be under control.

Capricorn

Today, you may be blessed by your destiny, your postponed projects may be started now, with the help of elder’s blessings, messy situation is now under control, which may speed up your project. Disputes between family members may likely to be resolved which may increase your domestic harmony. You may be attracted by glamour.

Aquarius

Today is a good day, you are enthusiastic today. With the help of good focus, you may perform better in business and work. Your boss may be supportive; you may get some new responsibilities in terms of promotion. There may be some visit to religious place. It is advised to avoid arrogance in your love life.

Pisces

Today you are blessed by moon, your destiny is with you, your postponed projects are likely to be started now. You may have elder’s blessings, which may help you to come out from the messy situation, which may boost the speed of your work. Domestic harmony may make you happy after resolving some disputes between family members. Your creativity may be improved now; movies, glamour may attract you.

The author, Samir Jain, is a Jaipur based astrologer who is an expert in astrology, numerology, palmistry and Vastu. He is also an expert in Jain Temple Vastu and Jain Jyotish. Over the last several years, he has consulted clients from the USA, Brazil, Mexico, Canada, the UK, Australia, Turkey, France, Italy, South Africa, and Germany.

#astrology #horoscope #dailyhoroscope #horoscopetoday #horoscopejanuary #januaryhoroscope

Title: Dalma elephant corridor: Green brakes on Rs 100 crore airport project
Content:
This story is from January 20, 2020

Elephants travel from Dalma to Bengal every year. In 2018-19 (till 31 March, 2019), 452 people were killed by ... Read More

KOLKATA: Elephant corridors from Dalma to Bengal have come in the way of an airport in Jharkhand.

An expert panel of the ministry of environment, forests and climate change (MoEFCC) has recommended to put the proposed Dhalbhumgarh airport on hold because it will affect animal corridors and increase the risk of man-elephant conflict in the Bengal-Jharkhand border region. Around 100 hectares of reserve forests will have to be cleared to make way for the airport and its ancillaries, the panel noted.

The Airports Authority of India, in a joint venture with the Jharkhand government, was supposed to develop the airport on an abandoned WWII airfield — situated around 15km from the Bengal-Jharkhand border and around 60km from Jamshedpur — for fair-weather operations of ATR-72 aircraft. The total land required for the Rs 100-crore project is 97.2 hectares, of which 96.8 hectares falls within reserve forest area.

At its meeting in New Delhi on December 26 and 27, 2019, the expert appraisal committee (EAC) said the proposed forested site near Dalma Wildlife Sanctuary in Jharkhand is an elephant habitat. “Elephants travel from Dalma to Bengal through this forest. Every year, there are number of man-elephant conflict cases in these areas,” it said. The noise of aircraft and traffic movement will affect the elephants’ behaviour, it noted.

AAI regional executive director (east), S P Yadav, said: “The project was lined up by our corporate headquarters. I will enquire about the next course of action by them.”

In 2018-19 (till 31 March, 2019), 452 people were killed by elephants across the country. Of these, the maximum number of deaths (87) took place in Jharkhand. In Bengal, 52 human lives were lost in 2018-19 (till 31 March, 2019).

The AAI had sought forest clearance to “divert” (for 99 years) no less than 99.256 hectares of forest land (53.788 hectares of reserved forest, 0.065 hectares of protected forest and 45.403 hectares of unclassed forest). The total number of trees to be felled — the AAI’s forest clearance application (proposal No. FP/JH/Others/41404/2019) mentions — is 79,332. And wildlife present in that forest, according to the AAI’s application, include Asiatic elephant, indigenous and migratory birds, fox and wild cat.

“All around the proposed site, the only land available is reserved forest,” the committee noted. “Any kind of ancillary development which is bound to come up and further phase-2 development will also require land, which will only be forest land,” it added. The committee said since the proposed site is supposed to cater to Jamshedpur, creation of an airport at a site nearer to that town will be better.

The forest clearance application, filed on 31 July, 2019, is pending at the DFO/DCF level. Dhalbhumgarh DFO Abhishek Kumar said: “If the airport is built, it will affect the habitat of all wild animals here. And if elephant habitat is affected, that would increase the risk of man-elephant conflict.”

Conservationist Joydip Kundu said an airport at Dhalbhumgarh will result in fragmentation of forests and affect the migration routes of elephants. “Why can’t they find some other place to build an airport? Just because wild animals don’t have voting rights?”

Title: Penalty norms for delayed projects relaxed in Greater Noida
Content:
This story is from January 20, 2020

The GNIDA has changed how it calculates money owed by developers, allowing them to pay penalties for delayed construction later. With this, cash-strapped builders can now seek funds from financial institutions or seek bailout packages.

“We will give permission to developers to seek mortgage from financial institutions as soon as they settle our core dues. Penalty on delayed construction will be charged later on. However, at the time of giving occupancy certificate, a committee will check if all the dues , including applicable construction penalty, had been settled,” said Narendra Bhooshan, the chief executive officer of GNIDA who approved the policy on Friday.

Premium for plot allotment and rent arrears make up the largest part of the dues. The Authority had started allotting plots in 2003. It has been revising its time extension policy, which covers penal provisions for delayed construction, from time to time. The Authority had charged 10% of the premium upfront and the remaining money was to be paid in instalments.

If a builder failed to finish a project in seven years, a monthly interest rate of 1-2% would be applicable. Since plots are given out on 90-year leases, the Authority also demanded rent. It had issued notices to developers who had not completed projects within deadline and had to pay their dues along with interest.

“This logjam led to a vicious cycle. It did not allow construction work over pending dues. Developers were not able to pay off the dues since projects got stuck and they received no money from buyers. The actual amount due from developers is much less than what is being claimed by the Authority. We raised this problem before the Authority and are glad that a positive decision has been taken,” said Manoj Gaur, chairman of CREDAI's affordable housing committee and managing director of Gaurs Group.

Several regulatory bodies sided with the developers because the construction delay, in many cases, took place as the Authority was unable to acquire the land and hand it over to the developers on time. The state government had passed an order in December last year extending benefits to such builders, like zero-period, and asked the authority to re-calculate the penal amount for construction delay accordingly.

Bhooshan said that during an assessment, it was found that 35,000 to 40,000 units could be completed if some builders could secure last-mile funding. Close to 1.25 lakh of the planned 2.5 lakh units in Greater Noida are yet to be delivered. About 42,000 flats of these were planned by the Amrapali group.GREATER NOIDA : The GNIDA has changed how it calculates money owed by developers, allowing them to pay penalties for delayed construction later. With this, cash-strapped builders can now seek funds from financial institutions or seek bailout packages.

“We will give permission to developers to seek mortgage from financial institutions as soon as they settle our core dues. Penalty on delayed construction will be charged later on. However, at the time of giving occupancy certificate, a committee will check if all the dues, including applicable construction penalty, had been settled,” said Narendra Bhooshan, the chief executive officer of GNIDA who approved the policy on Friday.

Premium for plot allotment and rent arrears make up the largest part of the dues. The Authority had started allotting plots in 2003. It has been revising its time extension policy, which covers penal provisions for delayed construction, from time to time. The Authority had charged 10% of the premium upfront and the remaining money was to be paid in instalments.

If a builder failed to finish a project in seven years, a monthly interest rate of 1-2% would be applicable. Since plots are given out on 90-year leases, the Authority also demanded rent. It had issued notices to developers who had not completed projects within deadline and had to pay their dues along with interest.

“This logjam led to a vicious cycle. It did not allow construction work over pending dues. Developers were not able to pay off the dues since projects got stuck and they received no money from buyers. The actual amount due from developers is much less than what is being claimed by the Authority. We raised this problem before the Authority and are glad that a positive decision has been taken,” said Manoj Gaur, president of CREDAI (NCR).

Several regulatory bodies sided with the developers because the construction delay, in many cases, took place as the Authority was unable to acquire the land and hand it over to the developers on time.

The state government had passed an order in December last year extending benefits to such builders, like zero-period, and asked the authority to re-calculate the penal amount for construction delay accordingly.

Bhooshan said that during an assessment, it was found that 35,000 to 40,000 units could be completed if some builders could secure last-mile funding.

Close to 1.25 lakh of the planned 2.5 lakh units in Greater Noida are yet to be delivered. About 42,000 flats of these were planned by the Amrapali group.

Title: 15 devotees may be allowed Anjediva visit in February
Content:
This story is from January 20, 2020

The feast of Our Lady of Springs is celebrated on February 2

POINGUINIM: Just 15 devotees are likely to get permission from the state government to celebrate the feast of Our Lady of Springs at Anjediva island early next month.

Located off the coast of Canacona, the island is occupied by the Navy and has been out of bounds for devotees who seek to celebrate the feasts of Our Lady of Springs in February and St Francis de Assisi in October.

Suraj Naik, personal secretary of the minister of state for defence, Shripad Naik, on Tuesday informed Canacona resident Natividade D'Sa that at least 15 people would get permission to visit the island on February 2, the day of the feast. D'Sa, who has been pursuing the matter since June last year, was instructed to provide the names of the 15 devotees who would accompany him to the island.

D'Sa said he had received a call from Shripad Naik's office on Monday informing him that the minister of state for defence would meet him at Porvorim on Tuesday. However, the meeting did not take place as the minister had to leave for Delhi, he said.

The call for the meeting came after D'Sa filed an online complaint before the department of administrative reforms and public grievances, New Delhi, over permission to celebrate the two Catholic feasts at Anjediva island. The department had subsequently written to the South Goa collector, instructing that action be taken and the complainant intimated.

Deputy speaker and Canacona MLA Isidore Fernandes, on his part, said he would speak with the state's chief secretary to work out an amicable solution.

The Navy has denied citizens entry to Anjediva island since 2004 citing security concerns. The island has been handed over to the Navy for the Seabird project.

Title: Noida: Woman dies, cops say it’s accident, kin allege rape
Content:
Representative image

Family alleges rape, murder

(The victim's identity has not been revealed to protect her privacy as per Supreme court directives on cases related to sexual assault)

NOIDA: A 20-year-old woman succumbed to injuries allegedly suffered during an accident on the Yamuna Expressway on Friday evening. However, an FIR for gang rape was registered by Noida police on Sunday after the woman’s family said she had suffered serious injuries to her private parts. An autopsy is likely to be conducted on Monday.Police said the woman worked as a helper at a watch manufacturing unit in Sector 68. On Friday, she had left for work along with a female colleague and had told her family that she would be back home by 9.30pm. But late that evening, her father got a call from his daughter’s colleague, informing him that she had been admitted to Kailash Hospital in Jewar following an accident.When the woman’s father reached the hospital, there were two men and his daughter’s friend. As her condition deteriorated, the woman was referred to GTB Hospital in Delhi.Doctors at Kailash told TOI they had treated the woman “as a case of accident”. Dr Naresh Kumar, a casualty medical officer who had attended to the woman first, said an ambulance deployed on the Yamuna Expressway had brought the woman to the hospital around 7.30 pm on Friday.Asked about the nature of her injuries, Dr Kumar said she had suffered fractures in the thighs and forehead, and abrasions on the forehead, left cheek and right hand. The doctor, however, said injuries to her private parts were not examined. “Since it was a case of accident, it was treated as such,” he said.Noida police officers, too, claimed the woman had met with an accident. They said the woman, her friend and the two men were travelling on two bikes and had stopped for some time at Naujhil area in Mathura district.“According to the complaint, there were four persons on two separate bikes. The accident occurred in Naujhil area. A team has gone to investigate that. Two persons have been named in the case,” DCP (zone I) Sankalp Sharma told a news conference. “They had halted on the highway when a car — possibly an i10 or an i20 — hit the woman,” the officer added.The woman’s family has alleged that their daughter had been gang-raped as there were serious injuries to her private parts. The father — a cab driver — has named the two men and the female colleague who had accompanied his daughter in the complaint.The woman’s family claimed they had been informed at GTB Hospital on Saturday that it was possibly a case of rape. “She was bleeding from her private parts and had to be infused blood. We suspect she was gang-raped,” her mother said.GTB Hospital could not be reached for an independent comment.The woman’s father has also levelled allegations of inaction against the police. He said when he reached Sector 49 police station on Saturday evening, the cops there declined to lodge a case of gang rape.“The cops there told us they would lodge an FIR according to the report of Kailash Hospital. They refused to take the complaint of gang rape,” he said.The woman died at GTB Hospital around 6am on Sunday. Delhi Police informed their Noida counterparts about her death. An FIR under IPC sections 376-D (gang rape), 302 (murder) and section 3 (2) (V) of the SC/ST Act was registered against the two men after around 100 people from the woman’s village flocked to the police station. The two men have been detained. One of them is the woman’s neighbour while the other stays in a nearby village. The police said though they had lodged a complaint of gang rape, they would wait for the autopsy to be conducted. An autopsy is only possible on Monday as Sunday is a holiday, the police said.At the news conference on Sunday, DCP Sharma took the name of the woman’s father at least twice, which threatened to reveal her identity. The officer, however, said he had named the complainant in the case.In Video: Noida: 20-yr-old woman dies, cops say accident while kin allege gang rape

Title: Kochi: Debris removal to begin in a week
Content:
The removal of debris of the apartment complexes is likely to start in seven days

KOCHI: Parts of Kochi, including Maradu, were hit by rain on Sunday night bringing much relief from the dust clouds arising from the post-demolition works at the site of the razed apartment complexes.The removal of debris of the apartment complexes is likely to start in seven days, Maradu municipality officials said, though uncertainty still looms over where it will be dumped. Workers of Vijay Steels and Explosives have been separating steel and concrete blocks of the four apartment complexes ever since the demolitions took place.The debris, removed from the sites, will be transported to a yard identified by the agency at Kumbalam, sources said, though Kumbalam panchayat president Seetha Chakrapani said no agency has approached the panchayat officials seeking permission to dump the debris in the panchayat. She also reiterated that they would not allow any agency to dump the debris in their panchayat.At the same time, Prompt Enterprises, the agency selected for transporting the debris, said Vijay Steels and Explosives will inform them when the waste should be transported from the sites.Prompt Enterprises will present before the Pollution Control Board (PCB) and technical committee members in Thiruvananthapuram on Monday its mode of transportation of debris, recycling process and slurry management. Only then the PCB will give the temporary authorization for debris removal ."The agency needs PCB's consent for disposing of and recycling the debris. They should make it clear, where the debris would be stored, how long will it take to remove the debris, how they will recycle the debris and how the slurry will be removed," said a PCB official. Meanwhile, technical committee members and PCB officials said they could not reach near the debris of the second tower of Alfa Serene, some of which have fallen into backwaters."Currently, we can't remove the debris of the second tower. There is no space in the compound to dump the waste. We can start removing the debris of the second tower only after the site of first tower is cleared. A bank guarantee issued by Vijay Steels and Explosives is with Maradu municipality. It will be released only after the agency clear the debris. The issue over dumping debris at Kumbalam should be addressed by the municipality itself," said another PCB official.Kumbalam panchayat president said the local body is a small area surrounded by waterbodies. "Why should we bear the brunt of demolition of the buildings at Maradu municipality? They have more space to store debris. We don't have space and our local body consists of only 18 wards. The municipality should have identified the place earlier before demolishing the buildings, said Chakrapani.On Friday, Maradu municipality officials and special officer sub-collector Snehil Kumar Singh will appear before the state-level monitoring committee constituted by the National Green Tribunal to give an explanation on debris removal.

Title: Open garbage burning at foothills of Chandivali
Content:
This story is from January 20, 2020

Inspite of recent fire in Chemical factory, miscreants are burning garbage in open near same illegal chemical factory which caught fire ago.Is there any authority to watch and control these violators and take suo motto action against them?

Title: Canadian jobs menu could have Indian cooks salivating
Content: What’s cooking in Canada? For starters, it could be greater job opportunities for cooks, albeit with stiff competition. Immigration, Refugees and Citizenship Canada (IRCC), the government agency that oversees immigration to Canada, recently tweeted an article that featured Indian-origin chef Hemant Bhagwani."He’s opened over 40 restaurants in Toronto and is now embarking on another hospitality journey—bringing skilled chefs to Canada and creating jobs,” the tweet stated, using the hashtag #ImmigrationMatters.This doesn’t come as a surprise, given that the demand for cooks is high in Canada. Job-bank data available on a government agency website indicates, “For cooks, over the period 2017-2026, new job openings (arising from expansion demand and replacement demand) are expected to total 52,200.”While this spells good news, the data also indicates that the available supply—expected at 58,600 (arising from new qualified students and immigration) will result in a marginal surplus. This means stiff competition for those chefs aspiring to migrate to Canada in search of employment. However, those with an entrepreneurial streak can set up their own restaurants, as having a job offer is not mandatory for migration purposes. It’s likely that the Express Entry point-based immigration system will be a tough egg to crack, at least for some aspirants.“I had always dreamed of having my own business, specifically restaurants. However, I would not have become an entrepreneur without the Canadian government’s ‘Small Business Loan’ programme. This programme really supports the small business owner, provided that their homework is done, paperwork is in order and a clear business plan is in place,” Bhagwani told TOI.In 1999, when he moved to Canada, Indian food was looked down upon as most Indian restaurants were not up to par with others. He narrated: “I wanted to elevate the status of Indian food, and I wanted to serve it in a fine dining setting. That is exactly what I set out to do.” Since 2002, he has opened 49 restaurants with brands like Amaya, Kamasutra, Indian Street Food Co, Goa Indian Farm Kitchen and Good Karma.The Express Entry point-based immigration system was introduced in January, 2015 to enable skilled immigrants to work and obtain a permanent residency (which is akin to a US green card). Three economic immigration categories are covered by the Express Entry system—the Federal Skilled Worker Class, Canadian Experience Class and the Federal Skilled Trades Class.“A cook is considered a skilled occupation, under the Express Entry. Further a cook may be eligible for any of the three economic migration categories, each of which have different eligibility requirements,” David Cohen, senior partner at the immigration law firm of Campbell Cohen, told TOI.Bhagwani explains how he helps chefs migrate. “We get the chefs here on work permits (under the Express Entry route), after obtaining Labour Market Impact Assessment (LMIA) under the high wage stream. The salary rate is Canadian $23-25 an hour. This kind of LMIA supports permanent residence applications.”Later he helps the chefs master requisite language skills to enable them to qualify for permanent residence. The Ontario Immigration Nominee Program, the province’s economic immigration programme, which works in partnership with IRCC has also come in handy.He has helped nearly 60 cooks in their immigration journey and as expansion of business is on the cards, several more will be hired over the next few years.“Experience and the skills are more important for ethnic cuisines than formal educational qualifications. Several years of experience in commercial food preparation establishments is a must,” said Bhagwani.Under the Express Entry point based system, candidates complete an online profile and are given a Comprehensive Ranking System (CRS) score. The CRS score is divided into two portions based on various parameters and a maximum of 600 points can be earned under each portion.Post getting a score, candidates are placed in the Express Entry pool and ranked relative to each other. Those who rank above the cut-off score get invited to apply for migration.“The cut-off is interesting when it comes to an occupation like a cook. In November 2016, the government of Canada reduced the additional points a candidate receives for an eligible offer of arranged employment from 600 to 200 points for a senior management level position; and from 600 to 50 points for other skilled positions. This means that a cook with a CRS score of 250 who obtained an eligible job offer would see his or her score climb to 850, but now it will only increase to 300,” explains Cohen.This change has had its fallout. Cohen illustrates this by saying: “If you look at the 2015 Express Entry year-end report, ‘cook’ was the second most invited occupation, with 2,295 invites being issued (8% of total invitations). In 2017, cooks ranked much lower down at 28, with just 853 invites (1% of total invitations).“For those aspiring to migrate under this occupational category, some of the steps may be claiming all the CRS points they are entitled to—say, by improving their qualification, or by pursuing Express Entry-aligned provincial nominee programmes which provides an additional 600 points,” he added.

Title: PM wants to move House of Lords out of London to reconnect with voters: Report
Content:
This story is from January 20, 2020

LONDON: The peers in the House of Lords may be moved up to the city of York or Birmingham in the north of England while the parliament complex in London undergoes an extensive refurbishment programme in the coming years.

According to ‘The Sunday Times’, British PM Boris Johnson is contemplating the move and has ordered a review into the practicalities. It is seen as part of his post-election pledge to better engage with voters from the traditionally Labour Party heartlands in the north of England, who voted Conservative and handed him a landslide win last December. Besides the Lords, Johnson also plans to hold temporary touring sessions of the House of Commons in different parts of the country. “The York proposal is much further along. The PM is also keen to have parliamentary sessions in the regions, be it Sunderland or Manchester , so people get a chance to feel democracy in action first hand,” a government source was quoted by the newspaper as saying.

The Conservative Party has already announced that its campaign headquarters will move out of London.

Title: Goa: Talpona no longer on 'polluted rivers' list
Content:
This story is from January 20, 2020

The Talpona showed improvements in water quality parameters like pH, dissolved oxygen, biochemical oxygen dema... Read More

PANAJI: The state government's River Rejuvenation Committee (RRC-Goa) has approved the revised action plans for stretches of the Mandovi and the Sal rivers, which involve expediting the installation of a sewerage network and strengthening the institutional mechanism for solid waste management. RRC-Goa has also decided to 'de-list' the Talpona river stretch from the list of eleven polluted river stretches in the state.

The revised action plan would be submitted to the Central Pollution Control Board (CPCB) for approval as per the National Green Tribunal (NGT) order. "There is no industrial discharge into any of the polluted river stretches," a senior government officer said.

Interventions listed in the action plan are being monitored on regular basis through the department of panchayats (DoP) , the department of municipal administration (DMA), public works department (PWD) and the directorate of health services (DHS).

The Goa state pollution control board (GSPCB) has levied fines under the 'polluter pays principle' (PPP) to commercial establishments located along the banks of the Mandovi for the release of untreated sewage, with instructions to provide sewage-treatment methodology withi

With respect to the Talpona river, on-site interventions by the DoP- through the improvement of institutional mechanism in solid-waste management, by the DHS, through the issuance of notices against violators for illegal discharge of sewage, and the PWD, which disconnected electricity and water connections of violators, along with continual monthly monitoring of water quality by the board from April upto October 2019 has shown that the water quality parameters like pH , dissolved oxygen (DO), biochemical oxygen demand (BOD) and total coliform have improved, and are within the CPCB-prescribed parameters. The Goa Waste Managegement Corporation will provide bio toilets. Therefore, the Talpona no longer qualifies as a 'polluted river stretch' as per the criteria stipulated by the CPCB.

For the river Sal, the interventions being executed include the laying of a sewerage network, the diversion of Sirvodem and Khareband nullahs through SIDCGL, the de-silting of a polluted-stretch by the Captain of Ports and the provision of toilet facilities at fish-landing sites, that is being executed by the department of fisheries.

Title: Get set, go: Age no bar at this Greater Noida marathon
Content:
The event was hosted by Bennett University and was flagged off from the city park in Alpha sector.

GREATER NOIDA: Some ran to test their endurance, some as part of their daily fitness regime. But old and young alike, 700 people participated in the Greater Noida mini marathon on Sunday morning. The event was hosted by Bennett University and was flagged off from the city park in Alpha sector.The race started at 10am and ended by noon. The contest was held in two categories — 2km for senior citizens and 10km for others, said Sachin Jain, president of Bennett University. At the end of the race, prizes were handed out to the top three runners in both the categories.Jain said, “We are committed towards academic excellence at our institute. Through this initiative, we have achieved a bond and initiated an engagement with residents. This shows our commitment towards community development.”The winners expressed happiness. “It was a great day for me. I won the race and got a prize of Rs 25,000. I will be using this money for my running practice,” said Lakashiya Kashyap, the winner in the 10km category.For Renu Bohra, the top woman sprinter, sweating it out on a wintry morning was difficult. But she turned up anyway. “It was a great experience for all the participants. It was not easy for people to turn up on a winter morning, but sheer determination helped,” she said.While inaugurating the event, Narendra Bhooshan, the CEO of Greater Noida Authority, said, “Greater Noida is unique, organised, clean and green. It will emerge as one of the top cities in the country because of industrial units, road connectivity and the airport (at Jewar). We are working towards making this city smart and happy. This event is a gesture to involve citizens and work towards their happiness.”Alok Singh, the commissioner of police, also flagged off the marathon. He spoke about how his force planned to make the city safer.“Noida and Greater Noida residents are technology-driven and we will give them smart policing support. We have identified 150 spots for installing CCTV cameras and close monitoring of streets. Additionally, more than 90 choke points have been identified and we will resolve traffic issues there. We are also recruiting more traffic personnel to man our streets better. You can already access various services through UP Police’s mobile app. We will become more technology-driven in the times to come,” Singh said.

Title: All 191 panchayats begin dry waste collection at doorsteps
Content:
This story is from January 20, 2020

Several villages have also set up wet waste disposal facilities

PANAJI: All 191 village panchayats in the state have started door-to-door collection of dry waste, which is then sent to Goa Waste Management Corporation (GWMC) for scientific disposal, said the directorate of panchayats (DoP). A majority of village panchayats dispose wet waste at source, the directorate added.

Panchayats have issued 3,273 notices to houses across the state for direct or indirect discharge of waste water into rivers, the DoP said.

Panchayat have constructed sheds to store the dry waste before it sent to GWMC.

Altogether, 64 village panchayats in close proximity to municipal jurisdictions, tourist spots and semi-urban areas generate wet waste, of which 37 village panchayats carry out door-to-door collection of wet waste. 28 village panchayats send their wet waste to the Saligao plant and the other nine have set up their own wet waste disposal facilities. The DoP said 12 village panchayats have land available for setting up wet waste disposal facilities, which are under way and will becompleted within 6 months. The remaining 15 village panchayats are in the process of identifying land for the purpose, and will require a period of one year to set up treatment facilities.

127 village panchayats have mostly single dwelling units, which dispose of their wet waste at source.

Of the 3,273 violators, the DoP said 1,451 violators have constructed soak pits and 1,788 residents were in the process of constructing soak pits or septic tanks. The directorate of health services disconnected the water connections to 34 households for non-compliance, on request of the village panchayats under the Public Health Act.

The DoP said 264 bulk waste generators were identified by the village panchayats, out of which 218 bulk waste generators have set up wet waste disposal facilities and the remaining 46 are in the process of setting up the facilities.

All village panchayats have prepared the village waste management plan and submitted it to GWMC. The panchayats will strictly execute the plan prepared for proper collection, transportation and scientific disposal of waste.

DoP said all 191 village panchayats have taken the decision at their gram sabhas to ban plastic of 50 microns and below. For strict compliance, enforcement through imposing penalties is regularly done by the village panchayat secretaries, and public awareness campaigns are conducted to educate the people about the ban on plastic of 50 microns and below.

Content:

KOCHI: Flying squad of the forest department on Sunday arrested five people for allegedly trying to sell as many as five star tortoises (an IUCN-listed vulnerable species ). The arrested were identified as E Elankovan (46), V Madhu (23), E Bhaskar (30), J Andru (28) and M J Gigi (43). The star tortoises were brought from Salem to Kochi for sale. Title: GST Rates: Nirmala Sitharaman hints at status quo on GST rates
Content:
Union finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman (File photo)

‘Laws mustn’t look at biz with suspicion’

CHENNAI: Union finance minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Sunday said she had sought an assessment of the full year collection of goods and services tax ( GST ) before rationalising rates, indicating that a proposal by a panel of officers to increase levies may wait until April.The minister also advised against frequent change in rates, which had become the norm at every meeting of the GST Council, which is headed by the union finance minister, with states being members of the panel. The GST Council is the final decision-making body on rates and rules and has to meet at least once in three months.There is a proposal for reworking the slab and increase rates on several items — ranging from branded food items to mobile phones and economy class air travel. But a decision was deferred as states wanted an assessment of the impact of the new indirect tax regime on various products. Besides, many states, including those ruled by BJP , were not in favour of increasing rates under various slabs.At the Palkhiwala Centenary Celebration here, Sitharaman raised concerns over assessment of GST collections. “Ideally, everybody keeps telling that we must aim for one rate (GST), one tax, and one nation and so on. However, before we make such revisions, have we studied what the current rates have given us (collection) steadily for one full year?”The minister indicated that there were suggestions for an annual revision. “We did consider if the revision of rates could be a yearly exercise, which will be done after due consideration. However, if the technical, law, and fitment committees come back saying that such reduction would lead to an inversion, then all of us must have the largeness of heart to say — sorry, this (rate revision) cannot happen.”The FM raised complaints that every GST Council meeting, there is a big list of rate reduction on items, which even leads to discussions on changes in inverted duty structure.Sitharaman said the government is moving towards a direction where the law does not look at business enterprises with suspicion. She also said the industry and the government should work together to take the country’s economy to $5 trillion.The FM said her earnest attempt is to decriminalise matters concerning the Companies Act or other related laws, and also cited Tata Group head N Chandrasekharan’s speech in Mumbai on Monday, where he had said the government should trust its own citizens.Stressing further on the trust factor, Sitharaman said the government’s intention is not to distrust business houses and the road to $5-trillion economy will be much easier with mutual trust.(Agencies)

Title: Railway official, Alina clash over double tracking
Content:
This story is from January 20, 2020

Locals object to the work

VASCO: Tensions ran high during the annual inspection of the South Western Railway (SWR) with Cortalim MLA Alina Saldanha taking offence to statements made by SWR manager Ajay Kumar Singh on Sunday.

Saldanha was at the Vasco railway station along with panchayat members and the Cansaulim sarpanch to raise objections to the double tracking of the railway, on Sunday evening. During the interaction, Singh tried to impress upon the MLA that he is only a technical party and has no powers to decide on the work.

When Saldanha told him that many houses would face demolition, Singh said that in India many houses have been demolished. He added that they would be given compensation like others. Saldanha pointed out that these are 500-year-old heritage houses, to which Singh replied, "India has houses that are 5,000 years old. Goans were the invading force who came about 500 years back. When you all came, you all also must have destroyed houses here." He quickly added, "By you I meant Portuguese."

An angry Saldanha said, "I am an Indian, I am not Portuguese, I take strong objection to your statement." Singh then withdrew his statement.

Singh later told reporters that it all depends on the Centre and the local administration. "If they ask us to stop we will stop the work. We are not Mughals, Britishers or Portuguese. We don't have an army. If the extension is not required we will stop it. But the government should tell us."

Commenting on Singh's statement, she said, "This is why Goans are taken for granted. They feel we are Portuguese, so who cares for them, only Indians should be cared for. But we are Indians. His statement was definitely wrong."

Singh had come from Hubballi division. He stopped at 10 stations.

Title: Thiruvananthapuram: CPM to hold nationwide campaign against NPR
Content:
This story is from January 20, 2020

CPM general secretary Sitaram Yechury (R),chief minister Pinarayi Vijayan (L) and M A Baby in Thiruvananthapur... Read More

THIRUVANANTHAPURAM: CPM would hold a countrywide boycott campaign against the proposed National Population Registry ( NPR ) by asking people not to respond to questions that could lead to the preparation of the registry, CPM general secretary Sitaram Yechury said here on Sunday.

"These enumerators will have two sets of questions. One for census and the other for NPR. People are free to choose not to reveal NPR questions. There is nothing illegal in doing so. Such refusal doesn't entail any legal action. Rather it would push the government to a tight spot," he said in a news conference at the AKG Centre here. While the questions relating to census may be answered, the questions related to the NPR must not be. "Census-Yes. NPR-No, would be our motto," Yechury said.

Title: Budget 2020: Government must be transparent, reveal real fiscal deficit in Budget: Experts
Content:
(Representative image)

NEW DELHI: Amid calls for easing the fiscal deficit target to boost spending and accelerate growth, experts, including NITI Aayog , have urged the government to be transparent in revealing the actual deficit rather than resort to below the line and offbudget numbers to show a better picture.“If you take into account the Centre, states and PSUs, the off-budget items, the deficit is much higher than budgeted,” said a source, adding that the advice of the government think tank is to come clean on the deficit, which is a measure of the Centre’s net borrowings.Against the backdrop of a slowdown in the economy , growth is estimated at 5% in 2019-20, the slowest pace in 11 years, and there have been calls to ease the deficit target. The government aims to rein in the deficit at 3.3% of GDP in the current financial year, which ends in March. But sluggish revenues and spending commitments have already seen reaching 112.4% of the full-year Budget target of Rs 6.2 lakh crore at the end of December.Receipts from stake sale in state-run companies have also not taken off and there is a likelihood of the government missing the target of raising Rs 1.05 lakh crore from asset sales in the current fiscal. This has also triggered worries that the fiscal deficit target may be breached.“There is a need to be transparent and not resort to offline, below-the-lines items to suppress the real deficit. This will comfort everybody,” the source said, adding that the government may ease the target to step up spending at a time when reviving growth is a top priority. There is a section within the government which is of the view that the government need not be rigid about sticking to the deficit target at a time when growth revival has emerged as a number one priority.Former finance secretary Subhash Chandra Garg has estimated the fiscal deficit to widen to 3.7% to 4% of GDP in the current financial year. In a recent blog post, he has also said the real deficit would be 4.5-5% of GDP, taking into account spending linked to recapitalisation of banks and financial institutions, payment of food subsidy via the National Small Savings Fund and other such spending.His comments have drawn sharp reactions from government officials, who suggested that Garg as finance secretary opted against heeding to the advice of the disinvestment and revenue departments, while fixing high-receipts targets. “What was he doing last year, when the targets were being fixed? He was the finance secretary. Didn’t he see signs of the economy slowing down?” retorted an official.

Title: Goa: Court denies Frenchman's plea to return passport
Content:
This story is from January 20, 2020

Representative image

PANAJI: Observing that the offence of possessing commercial quantity of drugs is of a "very serious nature" and that there is every possibility that the accused may not return, a sessions judge recently turned down the request of a French national to have his passport returned.

The French national, Olmeta Regis Rene, sought the return of his passport and permission to travel to France for two months to visit his elderly parents, and produced photographs showing an elderly person hospitalised. He stated he had come to Goa for a short period and required to return to France.

"However, the request cannot be granted, instead the matter can be disposed of and in the event the applicant is acquitted, he can very well be deported to his native place," the court stated.

Sessions judge Irshad Agha observed that in most cases, accused persons who are of foreign origin deliberately commit some offence so that their stay in Goa is extended, and in most of these cases, their passport is not made available."In the present case, the application was filed for returning of the passport," judge Agha said. "Since there is every possibility that the accused may not return to Goa, the application filed on behalf of the accused cannot be accepted."

An FIR was registered against Rene by ANC in 2018 after the French national was caught in Anjuna with 4.5g of LSD, a commercial quantity.

Title: AP Legislative Council: YS Jaganmohan Reddy may scrap legislative council
Content:
YS Jaganmohan Reddy

VIJAYAWADA: Andhra Pradesh chief minister YS Jaganmohan Reddy has reportedly decided to scrap the legislative council . The CM has reportedly told the law department to prepare a draft bill withdrawing the council. The bill is likely to be tabled in the assembly session beginning on Monday.Jagan has taken the decision to abolish the upper house following the TDP rejecting the bills passed by the legislative assembly. The TDP has absolute majority in the 58-member legislative council, and it had rejected bills related to the introduction of English as medium of instruction at government schools in the winter session held in December.As there is no scope of YSR Congress getting majority in the near future to get the bills passed smoothly, Jagan has decided to abolish the council. The law department has already prepared a draft bill, and sent it to the CM for consideration late on Sunday evening.This would be the second time that the AP legislative council is being abolished. Interestingly, it was first abolished in 1985, when the TDP had come to power and the Congress had the majority in the council. Former chief minister K Rosaiah was the leader of the house then, and Congress gave a tough time to the TDP government headed by NT Rama Rao.However, the council was restored in 2007, by Jagan's father and then CM, late YS Rajasekhar Reddy, before going for the 2009 general election. Though YSR Congress has absolute majority in the legislative assembly - 151 of 175 members - it is finding tough to get bills passed by legislative council. TDP, led by senior politician Yanamala Ramakrishnudu, is giving a tough time to the Jaganmohan Reddy government in the council.As Jagan is likely to table important bills, including decentralisation of capital and abolition of APCRDA Act, and there is no possibility of the bills getting the approval in the council, the CM has decided to abolish the council in this session.Besides having majority, the council chairman and vice-chairman posts are also held by TDP members, which is also seen as a reason for Jagan to abolish the house.

Title: Poor upkeep to hit ops of Kochi Marina
Content:
This story is from January 20, 2020

The cracks on the wooden planks of the dock at Kochi Marina have been covered with aluminium sheets as a tempo... Read More

KOCHI: With the yachting season about to start, the Kochi International Marina is set to witness an increase in the inflow of foreign yachts. But the absence of annual maintenance and poor infrastructure lead to the decline of marina's popularity among international yachters even though the yachting community considers it a gateway to Red Sea Passage. Though around 12 yachts are anchored at the marina currently, problems including shallow berths, broken docks and cleats, poor lighting and intrusion of public are still concerns for yachters.

Kerala Tourism Development Corporation (KTDC), which owns the property, and Ocean Blue Boating Pvt Ltd, which runs it, remain idle. Yachters said the image of Kochi Marina is getting tarnished among global yachting community and they will soon be forced to declare it unsafe for sailors in yachting blogs and websites.

"For those yachters preferring passage through Suez Canal, the Kochi Marina is the only nearest port of call. Despite the call for a complete overhaul of the marina, which is close to the international maritime route with favourable conditions and minimum tidal variations throughout the year, KTDC is not making any investment in the project," said a marina official.

Yachters too said their complaints went unheard. "The wooden planks on the dock have decayed posing threat to sailors walking on it. Ocean Blue did not respond to my requests to fix it and when I went to the officials at Bolgatty, some minor action took place mostly to appease me. They patched the holes on the dock leading to our boat using aluminium sheets however, did nothing to the other docks. All of the sailboats are stuck in the mud at low tides and the dock steel pilings are rusted, broken and covered with barnacles. I think this marina will completely fall apart in a couple of years. Blogs about its poor condition is spreading in community blogs," said Wade Alarie, a Canadian sailor, who has been at the marina for 10 months.

"We sailors wonder what happens to the money, around Rs 26,000, paid by each yacht monthly to continue our boat's anchorage at the marina," said a sailor from Germany.

KTDC chairman M Vijayakumar said lack of funds has been a problem. "Last two years, post floods, have been troubling for KTDC due to fund crunch. Marina's upkeep will be a priority this year," he said.

Title: Mauvin Godinho must quit for impartial probe in death case: Congress
Content:
This story is from January 20, 2020

Mauvin Godinho

PANAJI: No sooner the FIR was registered in the Merces panch Prakash Naik death case, Congress demanded that BJP minister Mauvin Godinho immediately step down from the cabinet to ensure an impartial investigation into the death. Godinho's brother, Wilson was named in the FIR.

"We demand that Mauvin should immediately step down from the cabinet, or chief minister Pramod Sawant should sack him to ensure that the investigation in the case is impartial, and the one found responsible for the crime should be punished," Goa Pradesh Congress Committee president Girish Chodankar stated.

If Godinho doesn't step down from the cabinet, the party demanded that the chief minister should sack him so that those involved can be punished.

"It is obvious that there would be political pressure on the investigating officer as Godinho is a senior member in the cabinet," Chodankar stated.

The party hit out at the minister for defecting to BJP from Congress, and alleged he did so to "get out of corruption charges levelled against him in the past by the same party".

"The death also indicates how the land mafia has been operating in the state under BJP-led government's rule. A detailed investigation into this incident can help police unearth a larger conspiracy. But for that, the police should be provided a free hand," the state Congress president said.

Police had said that Naik allegedly shot himself dead at his residence in Merces on Friday minutes after posting a message on WhatsApp that he was "under tremendous pressure" from two persons over a property matter, which he could not "handle".

In the message, the former Merces sarpanch and sitting panch had stated he was tired of everything in life because of the "harassment" with regards to a garden at Voilem Bhat in Merces, police said.

He also said the two persons should compensate his family with Rs 2 crore, police said.

Title: HCL among top 10 global software companies: CEO
Content:
This story is from January 20, 2020

HCL CEO C Vijayakumar (File photo)

BENGALURU: If there’s a bellwether in the Indian IT services industry today, it will probably have to be HCL Technologies . The company made bold bets in infrastructure services, engineering services, and products & platforms. The first two paid off handsomely. The third too looks to be heading in the same direction.

So, even as some peers struggle, HCL continues to grow at a scorching pace. In the last 14 quarters, HCL’s revenue has grown from $6.4 billion to $9.7 billion (last 12 months’ basis), a 12% CAGR. That changed the pecking order in the Indian IT services landscape — HCL overtook Wipro in the 2019 fiscal to become the third-biggest company.

Over the same 14 quarters, its revenue per employee grew 14% CAGR to $68,000 — the highest in the industry. Some of the revenue growth is on account of acquisitions, but the buys — such as the $1.8-billion purchase of certain IBM products — are delivering results.

“We have a very unique position in the industry,” HCL CEO C Vijayakumar tells TOI in an exclusive interaction. “We created a software products business that did close to $340 million in revenue last quarter, which means we are at a $1.3-billion annualised run rate. Three years ago, we didn’t have this business. The software products business is the most attractive profit pool in the tech industry. In IT services, infrastructure and digital continue to be strong service lines. We have a leadership position in engineering services. So today, we would be among the top 10 software companies in the world,” he says.

But wouldn’t parts of the products portfolio be vulnerable to cloud and newer technologies? Would the IBM products be a long-term paying proposition? Vijayakumar says it’s the traditional application support and maintenance business — the mainstay of IT services companies — that is the most vulnerable today. As many applications are moving to SaaS or moving to an agile development method, there’s very little of pure-play support, he says.

HCL’s software business, he says, helped the products and platforms business to grow 16.8% sequentially in constant currency in the December quarter. “While we were very confident about our business model and strategy in the products and platforms space, this quarter has established in a very convincing way that our strategy is really playing out,” he says.

The IBM products it bought included one for secure application development, for secure device management, for marketing automation, for omnichannel e-commerce, for digital experience, for email and lowcode rapid application development, and for workstream collaboration. Many of these are onpremise applications.

Vijayakumar says though HCL’s big business of infrastructure management services is under pressure due to automation, there are still large parts of the market that have not been penetrated by outsourcing players. Support for infrastructure, he says, will continue as a lot of it is getting modernised. Increased cloud adoption is also putting a lot of demand on the network and HCL sees a big opportunity there to transform the network landscape. “As global players are getting weakened in this space, it opens a world of new opportunities,” he says.

Title: 'Dr Bomb' sharpened bomb-making skills on internet during 21-day parole
Content:
This story is from January 20, 2020

Jalees Ansari aka 'Dr Bomb'

LUCKNOW: Two days after Indian Mujahideen (IM) operative Jalees Ansari aka ' Dr Bomb ' was arrested by UP Special Task Force from Kanpur after he jumped parole from Ajmer prison, intelligence agencies revealed the 68-year-old convict was fine-tuning bomb-manufacturing techniques during his 21-day freedom.

A resident of Mumbai, Dr Bomb, was convicted for his role in the 1993 Ajmer blasts. He's also accused of masterminding 50 other explosions, including the Mumbai serial blasts. STF sleuths grilled Ansari for over eight hours on the purpose of his visit to Kanpur, before handing him over to Maharashtra ATS on 3-day transit remand. "He was the tech handle of Indian Mujahideen and specialised in making bombs to cause maximum damage through low-intensity explosions," said a senior STF officer.

Ansari first used cycles to set off explosives packed in a tiffin box at Chandpole area of Ajmer, making it the bombing trademark of IM. Since it's easy to buy cycles without registration or paper work, it was the best choice for carrying out blasts, the STF officer said.

Officiating senior superintendent of police, STF, Vishal Vikram Singh, said, "We have recovered a diary from Ansari in which he drew a list of cheap bomb ingredients from web links. During interrogation, Ansari only spoke about bomb-making and nothing else. We are also probing whether he was in touch with relatives in Sant Kabir Nagar. His call details during parole are being scanned," said the officer.

Later, UP ATS unit also questioned Ansari for several hours during which he enquired about the whereabouts of friends and other acquaintances in Kanpur and other UP districts.

Dr Bomb has 5 brothers - Anish who works in a plastic store shop, Raees a contractor, Laik a physics professor in Bandra, Zulfikar a civil engineer and Firoz makes plastic equipment.

Gulrez taxi driver, Javed civil engineer, Musab runs a general store.

Title: Telanagana: CJ gives cops four days to show proof of Osmania University professor's Maoist link
Content:
This story is from January 20, 2020

OU associate professor Kaseem waves to the media as he is escorted by cops after deposing at CJ’s house on Sun... Read More

HYDERABAD: Telangana high court on Sunday directed the state and its police to furnish evidence within four days that arrested Osmania University (OU) associate professor Chintakindi Kaseem has links with Maoists. The Siddipet police brought Kaseem to the Chief Justice's residence on Sunday after the CJ had threatened to order a CBI inquiry against the police if they failed to produce him.

"These days the police are arresting several people in the name of being Maoist sympathisers. Now even professors are not being spared. Is the state trying to crush dissent this way by using its domain power," asked Chief Justice Raghavendra Singh Chauhan, who along with Justice Abhishek Reddy, was hearing a house motion moved by Telangana Civil Liberties Committee seeking Kaseem's production before the court.

Kaseem was arrested early on Saturday from his official residence on campus. Since October 4, 2019, 17 people have been arrested in Telangana for alleged links with Maoists.

"Show us evidence that he collected money from businessmen and used that to propagate Maoist ideology. Provide us evidence about his alleged travel to Chhattisgarh to participate in Maoist meetings," Chief Justice Chauhan told advocate general BS Prasad, who said there were six FIRs against Kaseem, including the current one and all mentioned his involvement in Maoist programmes.

The CJ recorded Kaseem's statement and directed authorities to consider his request to shift him to Cherlapalli prison from Sangareddy jail where he was remanded by a trial court.

Title: Telangana tops in revenue from jails, mulls e-store for prison products
Content:
This story is from January 20, 2020

Representative image

Title: Bihar: Cop shoots wife, self with AK-47 rifle in Sitamarhi
Content:
This story is from January 20, 2020

Representative image

SITAMARHI/PATNA: A 27-year-old police constable Chandra Bhushan Kumar shot dead his 24-year-old wife Madhu Kumari with an AK-47 rifle and later committed suicide by shooting himself with the same weapon in Sitamarhi district on Sunday morning. Family feud is suspected to be the reason behind the incident.

They were found dead in their rented accommodation at Simra village near the police lines in Sitamarhi district. The incident came to light when Kumar, a member of the quick response team (QRT) of the district police, didn't report to his duty.

Sitamarhi Sadar DSP Kumar Dheer Virendra said the incident took place around 4am. "When Kumar neither turned up on duty nor responded to phone calls, his colleagues visited his house around 10am and found the couple lying in a pool of blood. The room was locked from inside. The weapon was seized and the bodies were sent to the Sadar hospital for postmortem," the DSP said.

A forensic team from Patna visited the spot and collected evidences. The deceased belonged to Saur Bazar area in Saharsa district and had joined the police department in 2015. "He had got married about six months ago and lived with his wife in the house of Suryakant Maharaj," Dumra police station SHO Navlesh Kumar said.

Title: Bihar: Class IX student fakes kidnapping to buy motorbike
Content:
This story is from January 20, 2020

Representative image

PATNA: A 16-year-old boy was arrested and sent to remand home on Sunday for faking his own kidnapping for ransom to buy a high-end sports bike worth over 2 lakh. Police also arrested his 19-year-old cousin, Amit Kumar, for his connivance in the crime.

The Class IX student, whose father has been working in Russia for the past several years as a wielder, called his mother from his cellphone on Saturday and told her that he was kidnapped for Rs 15 lakh ransom. The juvenile from a village under Motipur police station area in Muzaffarpur was living with his maternal uncle at Raza Bazar under Shastri Nagar police station area in the state capital to pursue his studies in a private school.

His mother reached Shastri Nagar police station from Muzaffarpur in the evening and lodged a kidnapping case.

Patna SSP Upendra Kumar Sharma said the minor boy went to Varanasi by a train but returned as he was left with little money. Sharma said he would be charged for extortion from his mother in connivance with Amit, who was sent to jail.

The SSP said the juvenile told his mother around midnight that the kidnappers had released him near Patna Junction after noting his name and other details. "His sole purpose was to purchase a sports bike worth over Rs2 lakh for enjoyment. Besides, he had planned to invest in real estate after giving Rs1 lakh to Amit," he said.

Title: Andhra Pradesh: TTD to offer devotees one free laddu from today
Content:
This story is from January 20, 2020

Lord Venkateswara temple at Tirumala. (File photo)

TIRUPATI: Starting Monday, the Tirupati laddu will be issued free of cost to devotees on pilgrimage to the sacred abode of Lord Venkateswara at Tirumala. On December 31, 2019, the temple administration had announced that it would issue one laddu free of cost to every devotee visiting the temple, beginning January 20.

This decision is being set into action with the launch of 'one free Tirupati laddu for every devotee scheme' at the Tirumala temple , from Monday.

Speaking to TOI, TTD's additional EO AV Dharma Reddy said that a free laddu would be issued to every devotee, regardless of whether they were a VIP or common devotee. "All devotees are equal before the almighty and everyone will be entitled to receive one free Tirupati laddu once they complete darshan."

The additional EO also clarified that the temple administration was not hiking the price of the laddu. "The price for one laddu is still 50. We have just decided to cancel the issuance of laddus at subsidised prices," he clarified. Till recently, TTD provided free laddus only to divya darshan devotees daily. For others, the laddus were sold at subsidised prices. With the new scheme, the temple administration will have done away with these subsidies, which had also led to a black market business thriving at the temple town.

According to sources, even after issuing one free laddu to every devotee, the temple administration will save 250 crore per annum by removing the subsidies. Availing additional laddus has also become easier. Devotees can now buy additional laddus from counters next to where they get the free laddu. TTD has set up 12 additional laddu token counters, where devotees can buy additional laddus by paying 50 per laddu.

Title: Opposition doing 'cheerharan' by spreading lies: Yogi Adityanath
Content:
This story is from January 20, 2020

CM Yogi Adityanath at pro-CAA rally in Gorakhpur on Sunday.

Title: Bigg Boss 13: Mahira Sharma cries on being called weak; calls Asim ‘ehsaan faramosh’
Content: In the latest episode of Bigg Boss 13 Weekend Ka Vaar, Mahira Sharma was in a mood to give back to her haters. The actress not only called Asim Riaz ‘ehsaan faramosh’ and selfish but also fought with him and Rashami Desai for considering her weak in the game.When Sara and Kartik asked who they won’t keep in touch with outside the house, Vishal Aditya Singh and Arti Singh’ took each other’s names, Asim chose Paras Chhabra , Rashami picked Sidharth. Paras and Shehnaz took each other’s names. An irked Sidharth said he would not like to see Shehnaz as she keeps jumping on other guys like Gautam and Kartik. Shefali Jariwala took Asim’s name. This question made Mahira call Asim ‘ehsaan farmosh’ and selfish, and somebody she would not like to meet ever.In the last leg of the episode, Mahira began to cry as she was called weak by other contestants. She told Salman how Rashami and Asim think she is surviving in the house due to Paras which is untrue. Rashami countered her claims. She told Mahira that it is Paras who speaks on her behalf and she should do it herself. She added this makes her look weak. Mahira told Salman that even Asim speaks for Rashami.Mahira narrated a few instances wherein Rashami had spoked ill about her behind her back. The former accused the latter of not having the guts to say anything to her face. Rashami denied it. She told Salman that everyone in the house started calling her ‘chugalkhor’ after he said it on one of the Weekend Ka Vaar episodes. Salman then made light of the situation and changed the topic.

Title: Hyderabadi artists join hands to protect Asian elephants
Content: Art can create, art can heal. It can also help spread awareness and further a cause. It was this belief that motivated city’s leading artists to join hands with animal lovers to create 26 elephant figurines to spread the message of elephant conservation.Fiber glass figurines of the tuskers were presented to the artists by curator Nagesh Goud , who came up with the concept. The artists then created versions of the elephant figurine depending on their preferred medium and expertise.Fawad Tamkanat, one of the artists, said, “This was an attempt by artists to do something for those who cannot speak for themselves. It felt great to be able to do some good through my art.”Artist Chinthala Jagadish too echoed the same sentiment, “The proceeds from the sale of each of these pieces go towards the conservation of elephants. Being an animal lover myself, Ijumped at the opportunity to contribute to their conservation. It was an exciting show to be a part of not just for the cause but also because of the spirit with which artists came on board to contributed for a noble cause,” he said.Tollywood stars Lakshmi Manchu and Renu Desai were also spotted at the show that was attended by more than 100 people. The crowd was seen listening with rapt attention as the artists explained the inspiration behind their works. Discussions about art and wildlife conservation followed.

Title: Withdraw amendment to PLPA, urge residents
Content:
This story is from January 20, 2020

Protesters conducted a ‘funeral’ prayer with a ‘corpse’ of Aravalis.

GURUGRAM: Dressed in white, more than 100 residents gathered at Sikanderpur metro station on Sunday to carry out the ‘funeral rites’ of the Aravalis in protest against the Punjab Land Preservation (Haryana Amendment) Act ( PLPA ), 2019 and continuous destruction of forest in the state.

The protesters marched from Sikanderpur metro station to MG Road metro station. They conducted a janaaza (funeral prayer) with a symbolic ‘corpse’ of the Aravalis, and demanded immediate withdrawal of the Act and protection of the forest cover in the region.

Residents from across the city, including women, college students and children, raised slogans like “Withdraw PLPA Amendment Act”, “Aravali bachao”, and “Stop illegal constructions in our forests” during the protest.

“The amendment to PLPA, which has been signed by the Haryana governor, is the death knell for our forests. If notified, 60,000 acres of protected forest in the Aravalis and 10,000 acres of forest in the Shivaliks near Chandigarh will be opened up for real estate development. This amounts to a loss of 33% of forests when the state already has the lowest cover in India – barely 3.62% as compared to the national average of 20%,” said Dr Sarika Verma, an ENT surgeon and a Gurgaon resident. ”Having come from Gujarat, I grew up in the lap of the Aravalis. Delhi and NCR’s air pollution will worsen if there is construction in the Aravalis,” said Anurag, a student from Delhi University.

The residents demanded setting up of a task force to check encroachment and increasing Haryana’s forest cover to 5% in the next five years.
